pages.text: In a painting you have seen a fantastic creature that seems to be made of [#](bb00bb)Soul Sand[#]() and [#](bb00bb)Wither Skeleton Skulls[#](). For hours you waited in a Nether Fortress, only to almost lose your head yourself while searching for a Wither Skeleton with a spine loose enough to drop its skull. Heads up, you never were the one to bury your head in the sand.

pages.title: Getting Mob Heads
pages.text: But then there were the Creepers! Struck by lightning, they explode so hefty that they blow their opponent's heads right off their necks (worst case: yours).\To replicate this, you thought out this new enchantment using [Storm Stones](book://resources/storm_stones).\And so Treasure Hunter was born, allowing you to collect [all kinds of Mob Heads](book://creating_life/mob_heads).

pages.title: Characteristics
pages.text: Occasionally drops Mob Heads on kill.\\Max Level: 3\Applicable to axes and melee weapons.\Mutually exclusive with Looting.

pages.title: Enchanter Recipe
pages.text: You can infuse a [#](bb00bb)common Book[#]() with Treasure Hunter by surrounding your[Enchanter](book://enchanting/enchanter) with [Pigment](book://general/pigment) and the other required materials.

pages.title: Enchantment Upgrading
pages.text: Upgrading Treasure Hunter from level 1 to level 2 is fairly cheap at first.\This price will quickly increase to more and more [Pigment](book://general/pigment) and experience for each additional level.
